alert.note: Alert for Deltana and Tanana Flats (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 18 at 2:28PM AKDT until May 20 at 1:00AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM FRIDAY TO 1 AM AKDT SATURDAY FOR DELTANA AND TANANA FLATS... The National Weather Service in Fairbanks has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from 1 PM Friday to 1 AM AKDT Saturday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AFFECTED AREA...Deltana and Tanana Flats. * TIMING...From 1 PM Friday to 1 AM AKDT Saturday. * WINDS...Southeast 10 to 15 mph with gusts up to 25 mph. South winds 30 mph with gusts to 45 mph south of Delta Junction in the evening and overnight. * HUMIDITY...As low as 22 percent. Relative humidities will only recover to around 50 percent on Friday night from Delta Junction south. * TEMPERATURES...In the mid 70s. * IMPACTS...Rapid ignition, growth and spread of fires are possible.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that conditions are occurring or will occur which could lead to the development of large and dangerous fires. It is directed toward fire agencies, and through them, to the public. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
